level_1.title: Level 1: HTML Structure Basics
level_1.instruction: Welcome to Level 1! This section introduces the foundational tags every HTML page needs: <!DOCTYPE>, <html>, <head>, and <body>. You must always start here!
level_1.character_hint: Focus on the big picture before diving into the details. We'll start with the bare minimum.

level_1.title: Question 1: The Essential Doctype
level_1.instruction: Every modern HTML document must start with the Doctype declaration. Add the necessary tag to indicate this document is HTML5.
level_1.character_hint: It's the very first thing the browser reads! It doesn't need a closing tag.
level_1.run_output_message: Doctype added successfully. Now add the root element.

level_1.title: Question 2: The Root Tag
level_1.instruction: Wrap your entire document in the root element. Add the opening and closing tags for the main document structure.
level_1.character_hint: Remember the first line is the Doctype. This is the second!
level_1.run_output_message: The <html> tag is correct. Next, we need the head and body.

level_1.title: Question 3: Head and Body
level_1.instruction: Inside the root tag, you must define the two main sections: the container for metadata (head) and the container for visible content (body). Add both!
level_1.character_hint: The 'head' is for information *about* the page, the 'body' is for the visible stuff.
level_1.run_output_message: You've completed the basic HTML structure! That's Level 1 done!
